availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William R. Holbrook (Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer and private in 14th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Son of Braddock Holbrook and Judy Holbrook. Married to Susan Hamilton Holbrook in Morgan County, Kentucky, on December 28, 1854. Father of Mary Holbrook, Frances Holbrook, Ellen Holbrook, Franklin Holbrook, and Juda Holbrook. Laborer in Morgan County in 1850. Farmer in Morgan County in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as private from December 10, 1861 to January 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 131B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 518.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Elliott County, Precinct 3, p. 466A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Morgan County Marriages, Film #000216835, p. 24 of 37 microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 875.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 275.
Find A Grave, "William M. Holbrook (1831-1909)," Memorial #87826552, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87826552 (accessed November 28, 2020).
